page.title: 10KING LUD'S SSSI - details.
page.content: Comprising King Lud's Entrenchments, Cooper's Plantation, The Tent, Egypt Plantation and the Drift from 800 m north of Three Queens to Saltby Airfield. The site includes some of the best remaining examples of limestone grassland in Lincolnshire and Leicestershire and is representative of swards developed on soft limestones in southern and central England. The basic sward components are Brachypodium pinnatum (tor grass),Dactylis glomerata (cock's foot),Cynosurus cristatus (crested dog's tail),Festuca rubra (red fescue) and typical herbs include Sanguisorba minor (salad burnet),Pimpinella saxifraga (burnet-saxifrage),Knautia arvensis (field scabius),Veronica chamaedrys (germander speedwell),Lotus corniculatus (bird's foot trefoil), Hypericum perforatum(St John's wort).
